div.note: The distinctive expansion of CO in Bo2 (noted by Mosser) does not begin until f. 56r is reached and is calculated to fill all of f. 56; the ink on 56r (at least) also appears lighter than 55v.
div.l: With Rechneuer and recheles þis lessoıı̄un he lerys
With waste and with wranglere his owne pley ferys
With lytghthonde and with lykorouse mowth with vnschamfast
With drynke more ⁊and with drawe a bak her thryft is y past
With malaperte ⁊and with mysseavysed suche meyny þey hight
That wolle do but a lytull tylle her dyner bedyght
Thus þey stevyn whan þey myght mete
To pley at þe dyse in suche a prevey strete
For in londoıı̄un þer was none Apprentyse
That feirer couth caste a scharpe peir͗e of dyse
Than couthe Perkyn ⁊and þer to he was free
Large of his dispence in place of prevytee
With Magot ⁊and with Mylsent whan þat he mette
The bagge with þe powder͗e Anon was vnknette
His purs was inperfit he couthe notwelle kepe
Yet let vs be mery while oure sire is aslepe
With Pyes ⁊and with Pykrels with wyues moste swete
With loche ⁊and with lamprey þe childe myght not ete
The Tapster þe Taverner þe koke was nedy
Wolde clepe on perkyn for his purs was so redy
And þat fownde his Maister welle in his chaffare
For euery other day his boxe was lefte bare
An vnthryfty begynnyng for yong or for olde
A Prentyse to be a reueloure ⁊and ꝑparamours to holde
That bargeyn̄ no man̄ so sore schalle Abye
As his Maister þat hath no parte of his melodye
For theft ⁊and Ryot they beth inconuertyble
Alle thogh he can pley on Getern̄ ⁊and Rybible
Ravelle and trouthe as in a lowe degree
They mow mow not acorde al day men̄ it see
When þy purs is penyles where schalt þou haue more
Thou þat wylt not þe occupie no thyng therfore
Revell ys ordeyned to hem þat mow pay
But prentise ne pore man̄ þey mowe|notmowenotmowe not away
Euelle sponne wolle at the laste wolle come oute
They þou kepe it neuer so prevey in alytelle cloute
Thus þe Ioly prentyse with his maister abode
Tylle he was nye oute of his prenteshode
Alle thogh he were snybbyd bothe erly ⁊and late
Yet some tyme he was ladde with revell to newgate
But at þe laste as his Maister hym be thought
